message: Is there a way to configure git to always use --word-diff when running git diff (without a different alias, like "wdiff" or something)?
i was hoping to tell you you could create an alias called 'diff', but no bueno. you probably already tried that anyway.  just out of curiosity, why don't you want an alias?
Meh, I already have an alias
but I was just curious if you could change the default behavior of "git diff" itself..
@codekoala You could wrap all of git a la hub.
now i feel like sharing all my aliases: https://gist.github.com/902134
@coderanger wrap all of git a la hub? what does this mean?
@codekoala hub is a wrapper around git that makes it aware of github https://github.com/defunkt/hub

I got curious one day and checked my bash history for occurrences of gti. Keep in mind those are just the cases where I hit enter before I could correct it. That encouraged me to alias both gti and gt to git in bash. Afterward I checked my stats and I mistype git more than 20% of the time. Those aliases same me hours a month.
